intro: Centaurea secondaireana, commonly known as the secondary centaury, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble daisies. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and has narrow, grass-like leaves. Its flowers are usually blue or purple and bloom from late spring to early summer. Centaurea secondaireana is often used in ornamental gardening due to its attractive appearance and hardy nature.
